Name: Amulet
Description: An steatite amulet in the form of a heart. The Egyptians believed the heart to be the seat of all intelligence and originator of actions, as it also held the memories of the deceased it was the heart that was weighed at the moment of judgement. The heart was the only organ to remain inside the body during mummification. This amulet and the other three hearts (1967.60.32q, s & v) on the body were originally strung together but only fragments of the string survived.
